body: I just updated the logs to be more consistent with what I was seeing. This is what I'm typically seeing is having issues removing / renaming the .partial~ file in /tmp/rclone-spool* and the destination file never actually gets renamed.

The error

    ERROR : tv/The Office (US)/Season 1/The.Office.(US).S01E01.Pilot.DVD-SAVANNAH.avi.partial~: Dir.Rename error: can't move object - incompatible remotes

What it seems to be saying is that the underlying remote doesn't support Move.  However cache, drive and crypt should all support it.

What happens if you just use `mv` to rename a file in the mount - does that work?

@ncw 

```
user@mediaserver:/mnt/configs$ cp -v /mnt/deluge/downloads/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi /mnt/gcrypt/
'/mnt/deluge/downloads/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi' -> '/mnt/gcrypt/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi'
user@mediaserver:/mnt/configs$ mv /mnt/gcrypt/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi /mnt/gcrypt/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi-rename.test
mv: cannot move '/mnt/gcrypt/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi' to '/mnt/gcrypt/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi-rename.test': Input/output error
```

```
2017/11/19 15:56:31 DEBUG : /: >Lookup: node=<nil>, err=no such file or directory
2017/11/19 15:56:31 DEBUG : /: Rename: oldName="The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi", newName="The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi-rename.test", newDir=/
2017/11/19 15:56:31 ERROR : The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi: Dir.Rename error: can't move object - incompatible remotes
2017/11/19 15:56:31 DEBUG : /: >Rename: err=can't move object - incompatible remotes
```

I think the reason is that `cache` will accept Move from the same type of remote only.

@evulhotdog it's not clear where are you moving from. So the destination must be a `cache` remote but what's the source remote? Is it the same remote?

@remusb, the cp source was a local ext4, the destination was a crypt that's mounted on a cache, that's mounted on a remote (gdrive.)

The mv/rename was from crypt > crypt and that was what failed.
In my case, I moved a folder within the same drive / service

Ok, that's going to help. I'll try to reproduce it. It's not the first issue on a non-Mac reported so it seems I need to give the same attention to those OS's at least for the first version and write some good tests for them too.

Thanks @evulhotdog @Powerbless I'll come back with follow up questions if I can't reproduce it

issue.title: Cache - Path not found

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
rclone v1.38-105-g31d2fb4e
- os/arch: windows/amd64
- go version: go1.9.1

Windows 10 64 Bit

Gdrive Storage (Business unlimited)

ok â¦ after complete deleting the cache dir and start from scratch - after getting into subdir following error comes up :

2017/11/18 11:39:32 ERROR : IO error: file is too short to be encrypted
2017/11/18 11:39:32 ERROR : worker-1 : failed caching chunk in storage 0: open : Das System kann den angegebenen Pfad nicht finden.

Could not find the path - is it possible, that the path is to long (in cache dir) for Windows 10 ? (so storage in file system is not the best way to go ?)

Mounted dir then gets out of order - big dir has only one file left (the one i tried to open).

Gdrive -> Cache -> Crypt

Without Cache - everything accessable â¦ same structure - same storage â¦

rename.from: When attempting to move files to a crypt / cache / gdrive backend, it fails at moving / renaming / removing.
rename.to: When attempting to move files to a crypt / cache / gdrive backend, it fails at moving / renaming / removing

body:
I installed a Linux VM to start testing things in this OS. I went with the same one in this issue (Ubuntu 16.04).
I was able to reproduce this although I think it will happen on any other OS. The special aspect here is that it only happens if you do this in the root folder and it seems only if the file is first uploaded.

@ncw this seems to fail actually before it gets in cache. I see the Dir.Rename errors in vfs. One extra thing I got from the log:

```
2017/11/22 00:43:02 NOTICE: Encrypted drive 'crypt:': poll-interval is not supported by this remote
2017/11/22 00:43:42 INFO  : test-rename.mp4: Copied (new)
2017/11/22 00:43:42 ERROR : test-rename.mp4: File.applyPendingModTime error: chtimes /tmp/rclone-spool054503010/test-rename.mp4: no such file or directory
2017/11/22 00:43:50 ERROR : test-rename.mp4: Dir.Rename error: can't move object - incompatible remotes
```
I'll try to follow the thread and get to the source of the problem but I just wanted to paste this here maybe it rings a bell faster for you.

I should have a new version with some extra logging to at least rule out that the error thrown isn't accurate. I don't think the remote types is the issue. I'll post the new version once the build completes.

@remusb 
Upon further testing, it looks like you can't remove content that is recently cached or uploaded (not sure which.) I tried moving files that were not cached and that were on the remote from previous tests, and I was able to move it without issue. I then tried to move one that I uploaded and this was the result.

Per your additional logging that you added in 2497ca5 :
```
user@mediaserver:/mnt/configs$ time cp -v /mnt/deluge/downloads/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi /mnt/gcrypt/tv/
'/mnt/deluge/downloads/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi' -> '/mnt/gcrypt/tv/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi'

real    0m9.200s
user    0m0.000s
sys     0m0.108s
user@mediaserver:/mnt/configs$ mv /mnt/gcrypt/tv/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi /mnt/gcrypt/tv/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi.test.bak
mv: cannot move '/mnt/gcrypt/tv/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi' to '/mnt/gcrypt/tv/The.Office.US.S01E01.DVDRip.XviD-SAVANNAH.avi.test.bak': Input/output error
```
